meanings.sent1: The regressive technology was outdated and slow.
meanings.sent2: The regressive software caused more problems than it solved.
meanings.sent3: The regressive design of the old car made it look like a vintage gem.
meanings.sent4: Her regressive mindset held her back from embracing new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The regressive town was stuck in the past, refusing to progress.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a return to a former or less developed state
meanings.sent1: The regressive policies aimed to bring back outdated practices.
meanings.sent2: The regressive fashion trend made a comeback from the 80s.
meanings.sent3: His regressive behavior at the party was oddly nostalgic.
meanings.sent4: The regressive music style echoed the sounds of the past.
meanings.sent5: The regressive movie plot felt like a step back in time.

meanings.definition: Tending to return or revert to a previous state or condition
meanings.sent1: The regressive weather patterns indicated a shift towards colder temperatures.
meanings.sent2: The regressive market trends hinted at an economic downturn.
meanings.sent3: Their regressive cooking method accidentally turned into a fun experiment.
meanings.sent4: The regressive plant growth reminded her of the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The regressive road led them back to where they started.
